p: Postprandial lipid response varies with different dietary types. Hansson et al. studied the effects of different dairy products with similar fat content on postprandial TG of healthy adults. It was found that TG increment AUC of sour cream was 61% ( p < 0.01), 53% ( p < 0.01), and 23% ( p = 0.05) higher than that of whipped cream, butter, and cheese, respectively, indicating that the change of dietary structure may reduce postprandial lipemia ( 84). In addition, tart cherry has the ability to increase antioxidant activity and reduce TG level after HFM ( 85) ( Table 1).
